question: in the honour of which god is anant chaturdashi celebrated
chain_of_thought_result: Anant Chaturdashi is celebrated in honor of Lord Vishnu. It marks the end of the Ganesh Chaturthi festival and is dedicated to the worship of Lord Vishnu, particularly in his form as Anant, which symbolizes the infinite and eternal nature of the universe. Devotees often perform rituals and prayers to seek blessings for prosperity and well-being.
